website_summaries.verdict: Extremely tough dive bag and backpack combination that has a lot of pockets to store and sort gear.
pros: Very comfortable bag to carry, as it has backpack-style straps
For this style of dive bag, the main compartment is pretty large
Designed with six pockets, some of which have mesh material to provide airflow and ventilation for wet gear
cons: Drawstring pocket may not stay closed properly

customer_reviews.title: Thrilled! Perfect for non-scuba gear needs!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a backpack for my son because he rides his bike to school and has a large instrument case that he has to carry daily. The case is so awkward to carry while he's riding that he often ends up walking his bike or just leaving it at home. Received this awesome mesh gear bag today and the viola case fits with room to spare for his school supplies. I couldn't be happier! He loves it and says it's very comfortable, too. Excellent craftsmanship and awesome value!!
customer_reviews.author: hot tamale

customer_reviews.title: Bad drawstring, bad pocket
customer_reviews.text: Kinda small, but that's manageable. Drawstring has no clamp/clip to keep in cinched, so instantly reopens. Little accessory pocket's velcro won't stay shut and will dump your stuff out.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel L. Sharpe

customer_reviews.title: Zipper Corrosion - Bad Quality!
customer_reviews.text: This bag is terrible quality. My boyfriend and I bought these to carry our fins and snorkels. After just 3 uses all of the zippers have corroded heavily and are completely stuck! Mind you we keep the bags away from salt water and always hose them down with freshwater after going out. One of the zippers actually had a chunk break off. They corrode super easily. Save yourself the headache. Else you will regret it when your equipment is stuck inside your bag and you can no longer use it because the zippers are broken.
customer_reviews.author: Christine

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Unless You Use as a Backpack for Longer Distances
customer_reviews.text: Fits 34" freediving fins with some room to spare. After using for one summer with frequent backpacking to freediving spots I dropped the review from 5 to 4 stars due to the location of the backpack straps. The upper mounts are too high; if you carry this as a backpack the bottom of the bag will constantly bump into your legs. I ended up relocating the upper attachment some 6" lower and works perfectly now.
customer_reviews.author: motojapi

customer_reviews.title: This bag is awesome! I can fit my Cressi Gara Pro LD ...
customer_reviews.text: This bag is awesome! I can fit my Cressi Gara Pro LD Fins, Cressi Mask & Snorkel, GoPro and all accessories, Schrade dive knife, hood, dive socks, etc. Doesn't hang too low when wearing as a backpack. Some bags hang low, interferring with the movement of your legs near your knees. This bag is perfect for me to hike down to locations around Lake Tahoe
customer_reviews.author: Jawn

customer_reviews.title: Seems like a great bag.
customer_reviews.text: Fits my 36" cressi fins, mask, snorkel, belt with weights and my fin socks. Fits all my freedive stuff. I'll update my review for durability after some use.
customer_reviews.author: Seth R.

customer_reviews.title: Long fins baby
customer_reviews.text: Great bag for the price. Holds my beauchat plastics long fins and my small fins ,knife,snorkel,goggles even a microfiber towel and a water bottle! Make sure you get the correct one they have a few on the same page. Long fin one is great
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My snorkel bad
customer_reviews.text: Love this bag it holds everything we have...the tie string needs to be tired because it doesn't stay closed that's not a problem for us we tie a slip knot...
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Just what I was looking for and at a great price.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Fin Bag!
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE this fin bag! I purchased two bags; one for my husband and myself. He loves his - his fins are long, and fit perfectly in the bag. My fins are snorkeling fins, and there is enough room for my mask in it's case. We were so tired of dragging a huge HEAVY net dive bag on and off cruise ships...now we can carry our gear and keep our hands free! Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Robin W

customer_reviews.title: I use this for my snorkel, mask, fins ...
customer_reviews.text: I use this for my snorkel, mask, fins, and boots. Definitely has extra space and is so convenient as a backpack
customer_reviews.author: BRO

customer_reviews.title: Quality bag. Its a little snug but I can ...
customer_reviews.text: Quality bag. Its a little snug but I can get my BCD, fins, mask, snorkel, and booties all together in the same bag.
customer_reviews.author: Freddie Beavers

customer_reviews.title: Had nice padded straps
customer_reviews.text: We were able to fit both our snorkel gear into this large duffel. Well made, heavy duty! Had nice padded straps!
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl M.

customer_reviews.title: The freedive fin bag appears to be well-constructed and is ...
customer_reviews.text: The freedive fin bag appears to be well-constructed and is long enough for freediving fins. Some of the reviews posted are confusing, though, and seem to refer to the other products sold on the same page. This bag is fitted for fins. You could put your gloves, booties and a rashguard or hood in the larger pocket and ***maybe*** fit a 3 mil wetsuit in the main section around your fins. I couldn't cram my 5 mil in though.
customer_reviews.author: PD Kluge

customer_reviews.title: Great quality and size, perfect for freediving longfins!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great dive bag! Bought it as a gift for my boyfriend, and it holds his mask/snorkel/fins/accessories just fine. We haven't tried it yet but it might be able to even fit two sets of gear (maybe not two fins but definitely two masks and snorkels if you like to bring several.) The material and zippers both feel very well made and sturdy! For reference, his fins are 3' Subgear freediving fins and fit without any issue. We also both really love the backpack style straps and ventilation mesh!
customer_reviews.author: Corinnestein

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Very nice bag. Maybe just a little small for all my gear.
customer_reviews.author: Dexter

customer_reviews.title: Nice divers bag
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift for my husband who had been looking for a bag long enough for his free dive 36 inch fins. Many bags are not long enough. Has a separate place for his mask and snorkel which he liked. Best price was on Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: JoTop Contributor: Fashion Design

customer_reviews.title: Just came back from Florida keys - very happy with this product
customer_reviews.text: Just came back from Florida keys - very happy with this product. Sits on the back very comfortably, accommodates one free dive and one regular snorkel kit at the same time, plus diving skin, and all kinds of accessories.
customer_reviews.author: SharkShape

customer_reviews.title: awesome bag
customer_reviews.text: great color and size.. not too big and not too small.. I like the separate pocket for my regulator and fins..
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: ScubaMax BG-334 Freedive Fin Bag review
customer_reviews.text: I bought this bag for my husband as a gift. He likes it because the bag is big enough to fit his long fins. However, the pouches on the front aren't big enough to fit all the rest of his gear so he's buying a backup bag for all of his extra snorkels and other bits and pieces. I have to say, though, that it was hard to find a bag long enough to fit the fins - and this one does - so that's a win in his opinion.
customer_reviews.author: Mwim

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect!
customer_reviews.text: Bought two so that my wife and I could take our own freediving gear off the ship during our cruise. Perfect for the purpose. Only suggestion for improvement is just one inch more depth in the pockets and the compartment would allow for mask, sundries and booties to fit better.
customer_reviews.author: Jacksonville Manny

customer_reviews.title: Great water-gear bag.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this bag to cart around all my snorkel gear and my girlfriend's snorkel-gear, including wet suits. This bag is perfect - large enough to fit all my snorkel-gear, along with my girlfriends gear, too! Seems sturdy and strong.
customer_reviews.author: Meg Taber

customer_reviews.title: What an awesome bag! i bought it to replace my mesh ...
customer_reviews.text: What an awesome bag!i bought it to replace my mesh oversized duffle bag that was awkward to carry. Not only did it fit my 24" diving fins, 2 masks (in their containers, snorkels, misc stuff but it fit in overhead compartment with no problem, on the plane. It was very comfortable to wear walking around to go diving and it had plenty of room for my wetsuit & BCD.
customer_reviews.author: Susan Marvin

customer_reviews.title: this product its Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: this bag served me to perfection, I have fins called "PALAS" are ideal for long fins and pescasub and apnea Freediving, and enter fully into the bag, also enter my mask and snorkel, towel, and documents you need.
customer_reviews.author: Jose Rafael Figueroa

customer_reviews.title: Does the job well.
customer_reviews.text: Does the job well. I keep my fins and all my swimming gear in this bag. Recently went on trip with it and it fit in overhead. Works well.
customer_reviews.author: Mark J. Heulitt, MD

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: The backpack is great, very resistant and very comfortable. They come in different sizes so make sure you get the right one. Just one issue with the store. Some how the address was change on the package and took a while to get the package. I still believed that the store did a great job and was an individual mistake.
customer_reviews.author: H Rodrz

customer_reviews.title: This bag is great. It fits my size 14 fins and booties
customer_reviews.text: This bag is great. It fits my size 14 fins and booties, my wife's fins, both our masks (in cases) and snorkels and some other items small items easy. The bag is easy to clean the air vents helps to keep it from stinking.
customer_reviews.author: Cruzzes

customer_reviews.title: LOVE IT!
customer_reviews.text: Great space. Outside pocket for save a dive kit and extra stuff. I can even fit my wetsuit and boots on this backpack bag! I strongly recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: Adriana

customer_reviews.title: Huge
customer_reviews.text: This bag has room for all of my snorkeling stuff, including a full wetsuit. The length is perfect form my free-dive style fins.
customer_reviews.author: DAK

customer_reviews.title: freedive fin bag
customer_reviews.text: This bag is perfect for long fins and worked perfectly for additional items I would normally carry in a backpack. Very good value.
customer_reviews.author: jak

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: It works great, fit everything I needed for my day trip spearfishing in Catalina!
customer_reviews.author: Peter A. Fairweather

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect!
customer_reviews.text: The bag is a great size. I used the bag for standard size fins, mask and snorkel. The "added" size/length was great for a camera, sweatshirt and dry shorts. The bag has one draw back and that is it has no external straps or accessory hooks/loops.
customer_reviews.author: timothy k burgess jr

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for larger fins
customer_reviews.text: Fits my Spierre Carbons (38in x 10in) with room to spare. Solid construction and lots of extra storage space. I'm sure I'll be using this bag for years to come.
customer_reviews.author: O Sweet

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Worked great. Held all our equipment with no problem. Sturdy construction.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy

customer_reviews.title: Nice looking bag, that was a little too small for my needs
customer_reviews.text: Not to knock this bag, because it's of good quality, but I just couldn't fit all my scuba gear in here so I ended up returning it. Keep in mind that I had to pack in a BCD, regulator, fins, boots in the main fishnet section and my mask, snorkel, and gloves in the exterior pocket. There are other brands that could fit all the items I described above, so I returned this one.
customer_reviews.author: Citysmash

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Bag
customer_reviews.text: Holds all my gear including break-down pole spears, my Lobster noose and 2 large lobsters. My only issue would be the pull tags on the zipper are naff and keep pulling off. They need to be tied on rather than the system they have.
customer_reviews.author: T. Madeiros

customer_reviews.title: Recommended highly
customer_reviews.text: Fits my cressi gara 2000s, wet suit, weight belt, water shoes, two masks and snorkels, go pro. Recommended highly
customer_reviews.author: Xavier

customer_reviews.title: Great Bag!
customer_reviews.text: Excellant bag. Extremely tough and durable. Well made. Fits my freediving fins, snorkel, mask, freediving suit and accessories easily. Absolutely no issues with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Zebbycat

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Item is just as described. Nice,sturdy, and fit my cressi gara 2000s. I wish it would have came with a third side strap at the top though...
customer_reviews.author: alex rod

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This is exactly as advertised and what I wanted. It arrived promptly and was undamaged.
customer_reviews.author: Jimmy Armstrong

customer_reviews.title: Great Bag
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this bag every weekend during the summer months for over three years. The product has held up well in harsh conditions. Plenty of room to pack in your gear and many extras (food, first aid kit, etc). The two carry straps allow you to balance pack well on your back, freeing you to carry weight belt and other items. You don't have to struggle with bag slipping off your shoulders while you walk. I have been very pleased with the performance of this item.
customer_reviews.author: analogkid

customer_reviews.title: Great for expensive fins
customer_reviews.text: Got this when I bought freediving fins, C4 carbons with omer millenium foot pockets. It offers great protection and is easy to carry, also has extra pockets for mask, snorkel, defog and weightbelt.
customer_reviews.author: Carlos Granados

customer_reviews.title: My son was thrilled to open this up on Christmas morning.
customer_reviews.text: He has been wanting this bag since summer, and couldn't have been happier with it. Upon his return to FL he hopes to use it in the near future.
customer_reviews.author: John P. Heekin

customer_reviews.title: great buy
customer_reviews.text: awesome bag!!!it's huge and carries all of our snorkle gear towels extra clothes and beach stuff ....really strong worth every penny
customer_reviews.author: melissa ulanch

customer_reviews.title: all is very good!! fast shiping and great bag
customer_reviews.text: all is very good !! fast shiping and great bag . thanks.
customer_reviews.author: Arthur Sablinovsky

product_meta.title: ScubaMax Snorkeling and Diving Gear Bag
product_meta.description: Technical Details Color Feedive Fin Bag Material Type Heavy-duty Nylon Mfg Warranty Type (i.e. Parts, Labor) This product comes with a full manufacturer warranty. Package Height 5 x 9 x 12 inches Shipping Weight 2.8 pounds Size X-Large
feature_bullets: Heavy-Duty large scuba dive bag that can also used as a dive backpack
Large capacity is perfect for TWO sets of tropical dive equipment (BC, REG, 3mm Full Wetsuits, etc) with padded shoulder strap can be stored away
The main compartment contains two interior mesh pockets, two interior zippered ventilation windows, and two front exterior pockets
Quick-relaese waist strap works perfectly when you use this bag as a backpack
